required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Motivating a Spectrum of Cancer Patients to Quit Smoking
clinical_study.official_title: Motivating a Spectrum of Cancer Patients to Quit Smoking: Intervention Development and Feasibility

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess feasibility and acceptability of an intervention designed to increase smoking cessation motivation among patients with a cancer not widely known to be smoking related.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who consent to participate in the study- Feasibility
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who consent to participate in the study

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants that complete 1-week follow-up assessments - Feasibility
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who complete 1-week follow-up assessments

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants that complete 1 month follow-up assessments - Feasibility
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants who complete 1-month follow-up assessments
Number of study participants who read the booklet
Number of study participants who read the booklet
Treatment satisfaction measured with 8 items adapted from the Client Satisfaction Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the Contemplation Ladder
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in motivation to quit smoking will be assessed using the Contemplation Ladder. This is a validated measure for the assessment of readiness to quit smoking on a scale from 0 to 10. Higher scores indicate greater motivation to quit smoking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the short form of the smoking abstinence-related motivational engagement (ARME).
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in motivation to quit smoking will be assessed using the short form of the smoking abstinence-related motivational engagement (ARME), which is a valid and reliable measure of cessation motivation that includes 5 items related to the smokers' daily experience ranging from 1 (completely disagree) to 7 (completely agree). Higher scores indicate greater motivation to quit smoking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the Stages of Change Algorithm (SOC)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in motivation to quit smoking will be assessed using the Stages of Change algorithm (SOC). This is a widely used measure for the assessment of readiness to quit smoking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the number of visits to the study website
secondary_outcome.description: A personal code will be able to track the number of participants who visited the study website where participants will find existing smoking cessation resources. This will be considered a behavioral indicator of motivation to quit smoking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed by contact with the tobacco treatment specialist
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked if they have contacted the tobacco treatment specialist or if they would like us to make a referral for them. This will be considered a behavioral indicator of motivation to quit smoking.

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the number of quit attempts
secondary_outcome.description: One item will assessed if participants had a quit attempt that lasted at least 24 hours (at the 1-week assessment) and how many times participants quit smoking in the last 30 days (at the 1-month assessment).

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the number of quit attempts at 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants that had a quit attempt that lasted at least 24 hours at the 1-week assessment and how many times participants quit smoking in the last 30 days (at the 1-month assessment).

secondary_outcome.measure: Motivation to quit smoking assessed with the number times participants quit smoking
secondary_outcome.description: Number times participants quit smoking in the last 30 days (at the 1-month assessment).
Smoking abstinence will be determined by a self-report of not smoking in the last 7 days and by a result of ≤5ppm in carbon monoxide breath testing.
Smoking abstinence will be determined by a self-report of not smoking in the last 30 days and by a result of ≤5ppm in carbon monoxide breath testing.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a smoking cessation booklet/pamphlet corresponding to their cancer type.

intervention.description: Self-help booklet targeted by cancer type to increase smoking cessation motivation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Smoking at least 1 cigarette in previous 30 days
- Diagnosis of breast, colorectal, gynecological, skin melanoma, or bladder cancer within the last 6 months
- Able to read/write English
- Able to give informed consent
- Not currently enrolled in a smoking cessation program
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having distant metastases
- Male patients with breast cancer
